location.name: Kabul
location.activity-description: Productive infrustructure, in sectors such as irrigation, transportation, energy, public buildings and..etc, are built in the district level throughout the country as per the districts development plans.

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: Indicators: 1a. Number of MHP projects implemented 1b. Number of households with access to an improved sustainable energy supply 1c. Number of regional energy awarness training conducted 2a. Number of transport sector projects implemented 2b. Number of households with access to improved transport infrastructure 3a. Number of public buildings and facility projects implemented 3b. Number of households with improved access to public buildings/facilities 4a. Number of disaster mitigation projects implemented 4b. Number of households benefiting from disaster mitigation projects 5a. Number of irrigation projects implemented 5b. Number of households benefiting from irrigation and agricultural projects 6a. Number of water supply projects implemented 6b. Number of households with access to potable water 7. Number of labour days created 8a. % progress on dam project in Badghis 8b.% progress in dam construction work 9a. % progress on water supply project main transmission line in Badghis 9b.% progress on City Water supply Network 10. Ongoing support to key Government entities in Badghis maintained i.e Machinery Park, MOWA, Water Testing Unit and Municipality

baseline.comment: Baseline: 1a. 174 MHP projects implemented generating 3.06 MW electricity. 1b. 34,329 Households with access to improved sustainable energy supply 1c. not data 2a. 519 transport sector projects implemented 2b. 641158 households with access to improved transport infrastructure 3a. 146 public buildings and facility projects implemented 3b. 344827 households with improved access to public buildings/facilities 4a. 795 disaster mitigation projects implemented 4b. 850409 households benefiting from disaster mitigation projects 5a. 428 irrigation projects implemented 5b. 536594 households benefiting from irrigation projects 6a. 595 water supply project implemented 6b. 312205 households with access to potable water 7. 2829458 labour days created 8a. 50% feasibility study and design completed 8.b. no data 9a. 51 %Water supply main transmission struction completed 9b. City water supply Network surveyed 10. Handover activities from AECID done

target.comment: Annual Targets: 1a. 40 Ongoing Micro Hydro Power will be completed generating 800 kW electricity and 2 new MHP will be initiated 1b. 9000 households with access to sustainable energy supply through electricity generated with MHP. 1c. Provide operation and maintenance training for 50 people on MHP operation for its sustainability. 2a. 36 transport sector projects implemented 2b. 127,056 households with access improved transport infrastructure 3a. 19 public building projects implemented 3b. 19,569 will have access to improve public building facilities 4a. 57 disaster mitigation projects implemented 4b. 66,260 households benefiting from disaster mitigation projects 5a. 19 irrigation projects implemented 5b. 8,498 household benefiting from irrigation projects 6a. 48 water supply projects implemented 6b. 20,295 households with access to potable water 7. 1,048,773 labor days will be created through implementation of NABDP projects in year 2014. 8. 20% implemented; 9. 60% implemented; 10. Effective operation Provincial Machinery Park; POWA, Water Testing Laboratory and Municipality services

actual.comment:
2014 Actual:
2.1a: 40 Micro Hydro Powers (MHP) were completed generating 764 KWs of electricity. 2.1b: 11,829 2.2a: 38 2.2b: 74,432 2.3a: 27 2.3b: 207,162 2.4a: 49 2.4b: 66,260 2.5a: 37 2.5b: 17,453 2.6a: 48 2.6b: 17,503 2.7: 1,005,514 2.8: 38% implemented
2.9: 100 % implemented
2.10: The Provincial Machinery Park is operational and continuing to provide ongoing support and technical training to key government entities in Badghis province.

target.comment:
2015 Annual Targets:
1a. 15 ongoing Micro Hydro Power and 1 pilot bio-gas will be completed, generating 652 KW of electricity 1b.3632 household with access to sustainable energy supply through electricity generated with MHP 1c.1462 Provincial Rural Rehabilitation and Development (PRRD) staff and District Development Assembly members will receive renewable energy awareness training 2a. 16 transport sector project implemented 2b. 57127 households will access improved transport infrastructure 3a 9 Public building implemented 3b. 25633 household will access to improved public building/facilities 4a 21 disaster mitigation projects implemented 4b. 47613 households benefiting from disaster mitigation projects 5a.13 irrigation project will be implemented 5b. 3575 households will be benefited from implementation of improved irrigation projects 6a.13 water supply project will be implemented 6b. 4,822 households will have access to potable water 7a. approximately 1,144367 labor days will be created through implementation of NABDP project in year 2015. 8a. 100% Feasibility Study and design will be completed 8b. no data 9a. 100% water supply main transmission line structure completed 9b. 40% city water supply network completed 10. AECID activities will smoothly be progressed

location.name: Afghanistan
location.activity-description: This output supports all Provincial Governor Offices and Provincial Councils throughout Afghanistan.

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: (1) # of provinces having CD plan and strategies (2) # of Provincial Strategic Plans (PSPs) prepared (3) # of Provincial Development Plans (PDPs) prepared with ASGP support through a structured and participatory process (4) # of provinces with Citizen Service Centers for improved access to information and responsive governance (5) # of PGOs and DGOs with functioning admin. management system in accordance with IDLG operating guidelines (6) # of PCs trained in exercising oversight and representative functions in compliance with PC law

baseline.comment: 2.1. 81% in the PGOs and 72% in the DGOs 2.2. 3% in the PGOs and 0% in the DGOs 2.3. 59% in the PGOs and 46% in the DGOs 2.4. 8 PGOs and 3 DGOs 2.5. GOFORGOLD performance measurement system developed but not utilized at all due to its abstract and resourece-demanding nature 2.6. 4 PGOs 2.7. PSPs prepared in 7 provinces. PDPs prepared in all the provinces 2.8. None of the PGOs have liquidated LOA advances on time (affected by delays in Kabul) 2.9. GDCLCA does not have its page on the IDLG website 2.10. 27 2.11. 24

actual.comment: 2.1 -94.3% for PGOs; 89% for DGO 57 (2.1%) for PGOs, some 35 (or 2 %) for DGO. 29 PGOs implemented 2.2 – 29 2.3 - 90% for PGOs, 80A% for DGOs. 2.4 -13 PGOs and 4 DGOs 2.5 -18 2.6 -21 2.7 – 34PDPs & 5 Current PSPs 2.8 -26 2.9 -23 2.10 - 34 PCs hold 198 IMs 2.11 - 271 PC members from 22 PCs 2.12 - 34 former PCs and 24 newly-elected PCs included members that undertook monitoring mission to districts.

target.comment: 2.1 Number of tashkeel positions filled in PGOs and targeted DGOs. 95% of tashkeel positions filled in the Provincial Governor’s Office (PGOs). Female tashkeel constitute 3% of all employed tashkeel in the PGO. Female tashkeel constitute 5% of all employed tashkeel in the PGO 15 PGOs and 15 District Governors (DGOs) implement promotional/motivational activities to advocate for female recruitment. 2.2: 14 PGO HR plans includes Gender Mainstreaming (GM) session. 2.3: 50% of PGO and 25% 0f targeted DGO tashkeel staff trained on Office Manual. 2.4: Ten PGOs and five DGOs with a separate female toilet facility. 2.5: 23 PGOs have Provincial Gender Committees to support gender sensitive service delivery. 2.6:10 PGOs Implement Communication Strategies. 2.7: 34 Provinces Have Completed Provincial Development Plan (PDPs) and 10 Have Current and Completed Provincial Strategic Plans (PSPs). 2.8: 13 PGOs hold PDP conferences/ workshops/initiatives to launch/ develop the PDP. 2.9: 10 PGOs include tashkeel staff who receive Public Financial Management training during 2014. 2.10: All Provincial Council (PCs) hold twice monthly meetings with the PGO and also hold monthly internal meetings. 2.11: 306 PC members and 46 tashkeel staff receive training and orientation on PC law and responsibilities, relationship with line departments 2.12: 17 PCs (50%) include members that undertake monitoring missions to districts

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description:
1. Number of national and community based events organized (campaigns,trainings, conferences, semiars, , TV spots) for advocacy about the rights of women and girls

actual.comment: 1- Supported provided to International Women’s Day Celebration in 6 provinces and in Kabul 2-Equipment is procured for WACs and the recruitment is at the interview stage 3- 16 cadres are attending their classes at UMEF N-Peace members implemented their action plans in 2 target provinces supporting 558 DoWA staff, community members, religious leaders and school staff at Nangarhar and Herat regions on peace building process 4- N-Peace members implemented their action plans in 2 target provinces supporting 558 DoWA staff, community members, religious leaders and school staff at Nangarhar and Herat regions on peace building process

actual.comment: 1-With the joint venture of MAIL, FAO, WFP, SDU/UNDP and GEP-II efforts were geared to establish production cum demonstration centers. . 80 women beneficiaries have been provided with the agricultural land by MAIL with the technical support of SDU and GEP-II of UNDP and MAIL. 2- 9 BDS packages are in the process of development and project started strengthening the capacity of 10 women managed cooperatives 3- Govt. partners (MAIL, DAIL and DoWA) and UNDP /SDU have been mobilized to strengthen 9 women cooperative 4- established PWDCs strengthened identify, advocate for and monitor impact of interventions
